steps.text:
6:11 AM: You make your way across town as quickly as you can. The first rays of morning alight a town huddling in quiet fear. It is eerily silent. No early risers leaving their homes. Not even bird songs disturb the stillness. You focus inward, and relax for a moment. Then the first horrible note breaks the air. Somewhere, nearby, a voice sings out a dark and compelling melody. A song of hate and sorrow, resounding through the empty streets. A melody quickly joined by a second voice, then a third. In short order, the song is repeated all across the town of Arkham. But no matter how you adjust, you can always hear that first voice, above the din. Leading the chorus in its eldritch invocations. You feel a sting at the base of your skull, and your head goes momentarily fuzzy.

steps.title: Scenario Setup
steps.subtext: When gathering cards from Fallen Arkham, set all cards other than Grinning Victim aside.

steps.text: Put each location into play in the following clockwise order, starting with Orne Library: Orne Library, Ye Olde Magick Shoppe, General Store, Arkham Advertiser, Bank of Arkham, River Docks, Hibbs Roadhouse, Ma's Boarding House.
Shuffle the remainder of the encounter cards to form the encounter deck.
Each investigator earns experience equal to the Victory X value of each card in the victory display.
Check your campaign log. In a random order, for each location not marked as either "Defended" or "Infected", mark it as the value which appears less.
Because there are 6 Infected locations, the lead investigator must choose one to become Defended instead.
Because there are 7 or more Infected locations, the lead investigator must choose two to become Defended instead.
Check your campaign log. For each location recorded as "Defended", remove the following set aside cards from the game:
Arkham Advertiser: Bad News, Doyle Jeffries
Bank of Arkham: Bankrupture, The Vice President
General Store: Damaged Goods, The Loving Couple
Hibbs Roadhouse: Intoxicating Vapors, Hibbs (Just Gutted)
Ma's Boarding House: Broken Trust, Ma Matheson
Orne Library: You Know Too Much, Henry Armitage
River Docks: Worked to the Bone, The Thing in the Water
Ye Olde Magick Shoppe: Whispers of Power, Miriam Beecher
Add each set aside treachery not removed from the game in this way to the gathered encounter cards.
Check your campaign log. For each location in play that is "Infected", replace the current location with the location of the same name from the Fallen Arkham set.

Place the Priest of Plagues at a random [[Miasma]] location and a Minister of Sickness (ignoring its Forced condition) with 1 doom on it at the next clockwise location. These will form the initial Procession. (Note: see below)
The investigators begin play at the [[Stable]] location of their choice.
Set Worshipful Thrall aside, out of  play.
Shuffle one of the set aside [[Elite]] Fallen Arkham enemies and each Infected enemy to form the Procession deck.
<strike><red>Rejoice in fear. I live again. It is only a matter of time.</red></strike>
The first investigator to read this(even if undefeated) adds one [elder_thing] to the chaos bag for the remainder of the campaign.
Remember that "Hibb's Roadhouse" is the site of the unbinding.

steps.title: Procession
steps.text: The dark procession marching through Arkham modifies the behavior of the enemies within it.
When you "grow the Procession":

bullets.text: Draw the top enemy of the Procession deck.
Spawn it at the location clockwise of the last enemy in the Procession.
Place 1 doom on the new enemy.

steps.text: Ignore both the Hunter and Patrol keywords on enemies in the Procession.
When the Procession moves:

bullets.text: Move the Priest of Plagues one location in the counter-clockwise direction.

In clockwise order, each other ready enemy in the procession disengages from any investigators and moves directly to the location closest to the Priest with no other Procession enemies in the clockwise direction "following" the Priest. This can cause them to pass over exhausted enemies' locations.

steps.text: When an enemy in the Procession would be discarded from play, it is discarded to a separate Procession discard pile. When you would draw from an empty Procession deck, shuffle the Procession discard to form the new Procession deck, and draw the top card.
In your Campaign Log, record the name of each defeated investigator as *Investigator* has heeded the call.
In your Campaign Log, record Rallied under the name of each location you have "rallied".
In your Campaign Log, record the name of each [[Elite]] enemy in the victory display as Eliminated
In your Campaign Log, under the entry for the location that is the Site of Unbinding, cross out its name and record Crater of Unbinding.
In your Campaign Log, under the entry for the location that is the Site of Unbinding, record Site of Unbinding.

resolutions.title: Investigator Defeat
resolutions.text: You're not sure when you joined the procession. You're not sure how. But you wandered the streets in a daze, signing hymns you learned before you were born. It was beautiful.

resolutions.title: Resolution 1
resolutions.text:
As soon as the mortar fire stops, you watch the bloody viscera of the processions' remains form a strange sigil in the sky. Twisting shapes of green and red, it shifts and pulses like the veins of a living being. You grab hold of the nearest infected, and shake them, demanding an explanation.
"He is freed! He is reborn! They have heard the Call and killed us! Our undoing is his unbinding! The Bloody Unbinding!"
A terrible mistake has been made.

resolutions.title: Resolution 2
resolutions.text:
As the horrid music fades from your ears, you watch the bloody viscera of the priest form a strange sigil in the sky. Twisting shapes of green and red, it shifts and pulses like the veins of a living being. You grab hold of the nearest infected, and shake them, demanding an explanation.
"He is freed! He is reborn! You have heard the Call and killed us! Our undoing is his unbinding! The Bloody Unbinding!"
You have made a terrible mistake.
